revised_title: Atomic Hydrogen Reaction with n-Hexane: Decomposition and Product Analysis
tldr: The authors studied the reaction of n-hexane with atomic hydrogen using mercury photosensitization. They found that about one-third of the reacted hexane forms higher-boiling products, mainly dodecane. The reaction rate and product distribution were analyzed using gas chromatography, providing insights into the processes occurring in thermal decomposition and other reactions of paraffins.
